jtxt.emulator

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • jtxt.emulator.Context
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResizeSubject

    public class Context
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResizeSubject
    Encapsulates the properties of an instance of Terminal. Simple rendering hints, like the font size and family, as well as the number of lines and columns in the terminal are specified using a Configuration object, and passed to the Terminal constructor.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Region bounds
      The bounds of the root container of the terminal.
      (package private) java.awt.Dimension charSize
      The size of a character.
      java.awt.Font font
      The font used for rendering text in the window.
      private int lineSize
      The number of characters per line in the text-pane.
      private int numLines
      The number of lines in the text-pane.
      private java.util.List<ResizeSubscriber> resizeSubscribers
      All of the objects which wish to be notified when the dimensions of the text interface are changed.
      (package private) int updatesPerSecond
      The number of times per second that the terminal should poll for updates to state in the window.
      (package private) java.awt.Dimension windowSize
      The size of the text-pane.

      void subscribe(ResizeSubscriber subscriber)
      Adds the ResizeSubscriber as a subscriber of this subject; when a resize is triggered, the given subscriber will be notified through an invocation of it's ResizeSubscriber.resize(int, int) method.

    • Field Detail

      • lineSize

        private int lineSize
        The number of characters per line in the text-pane.

      • numLines

        private int numLines
        The number of lines in the text-pane.

      • font

        public final java.awt.Font font
        The font used for rendering text in the window.

      • charSize

        java.awt.Dimension charSize
        The size of a character. This is based on the font specified in the Configuration constructor. These need to be set by a Terminal instance since they rely on java.awt.FontMetrics.

      • windowSize

        java.awt.Dimension windowSize
        The size of the text-pane. This is calculated from the size of a glyph and the number of lines and columns.
        See Also:
        setCharDimensions(int, int)

      • resizeSubscribers

        private java.util.List<ResizeSubscriber> resizeSubscribers
        All of the objects which wish to be notified when the dimensions of the text interface are changed.

      • bounds

        private Region bounds
        The bounds of the root container of the terminal.

      • updatesPerSecond

        final int updatesPerSecond
        The number of times per second that the terminal should poll for updates to state in the window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Context

        public Context(Context context)
        Constructs a new Configuration object with properties identical to config.
        Parameters:
        context - The Configuration to replicate.

      • Context

        public Context(int lineSize,
               int numLines,
               java.lang.String fontName,
               int fontSize,
               int updatesPerSecond)
        Parameters:
        lineSize - The number of characters available on each line.
        numLines - The number of lines in the terminal.
        fontName - The name of the font to use for rendering the text in the terminal.
        fontSize - The size of the terminal's font.
        updatesPerSecond - The number of times per second that the terminal should poll the window to see if any changes need to be applied.

      • Context

        public Context(java.lang.String filename)
        Constructs a configuration for the given initialization file. See the documentation for details about property values and their respective format in the initialization file.
        Parameters:
        filename - An initialization file for this context, given appropriate key=value pairs for the emulator.

    • Method Detail

      • setCharDimensions

        void setCharDimensions(int charWidth,
                       int charHeight)
        Sets the dimensions of the font and calculates the size of the window based on the number of lines, line size, and the font dimensions.
        Parameters:
        charWidth - The width of a character based on font
        charHeight - The height of a character based on font.

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(ResizeSubscriber subscriber)
        Description copied from interface: ResizeSubject
        Adds the ResizeSubscriber as a subscriber of this subject; when a resize is triggered, the given subscriber will be notified through an invocation of it's ResizeSubscriber.resize(int, int) method.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface ResizeSubject
        Parameters:
        subscriber - The object which wishes to be notified whenever this subject's dimensions change.

      • remove

        public void remove(ResizeSubscriber subscriber)
        Description copied from interface: ResizeSubject
        Stops the given subscriber from receiving notifications about this subject being resized.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface ResizeSubject
        Parameters:
        subscriber - The subscriber which should stop receiving notifications.

      • resized

        public void resized()
        Description copied from interface: ResizeSubject
        A subscriber should call this method whenever the number of lines or the size of a line is changed by a client. This will ensure that all objects which rely on these dimensions are aware whenever they are changed.
        Specified by:
        resized in interface ResizeSubject
